result.execSummary:
The defendant Cody K. Meidam was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Armed w/ Dangerous Weapon [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Shall not possess any dangerous weapon.

No contact with victims, B.S. or K.K.
No contact with co-defendants Brandon Hudson, Jay Van Asten, Jr., or Dakota King-Whitney.
Absolute Sobriety - no alcohol or illegal drugs.
Shall not possess or consume any controlled substance or paraphernalia without a valid prescription.
No Taverns meaning the defendant shall not enter into or loiter near any establishment where the main purpose is the sale and/or consumption of alcohol, including liquor stores.
No Contact with any known drug users or dealers except in a treatment type setting.

DNA Sample/Surcharge - no sample necessary if previously provided.
Continue with current treatment, sign any releases for Agent.
Any other assessment/treatment/counseling recommended by Agent.
Pay Supervision Fees as determined by DOC.

timeConds.notes: W/Huber - 6 MONTHS STAYED - Court reserves the right to impose upon recommendation of Agent.
